sorcer.core.context

Class ServiceContext<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<String,Object>
        • sorcer.core.context.ServiceContext<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,Object>, AssociativeContext, SorcerConstants, Context<T>, Evaluation<T>, Identifiable, Revaluation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayContext, ControlContext, ListContext, PositionalContext, SharedAssociativeContext, SharedIndexedContext

    public class ServiceContext<T>
extends Hashtable<String,Object>
implements Context<T>, Identifiable, Revaluation, AssociativeContext, Serializable, SorcerConstants
    Implements the base-level service context interface Context.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceContext

        public ServiceContext()
        Default constructor for the ServiceContext class. The constructor calls the method init, defines the the service context name sets the root name to a blank string creates a new hash tables for path identifications, delPath, and linked paths. The constructor creates the context identification number via the UUID factory generate method.

      • isRevaluable

        public boolean isRevaluable()

        Returns true if this context is revaluable, otherwise false. If context is revaluable then the values of this context that implement the Evaluation interface are evaluated for its requested evaluated values.

      • mark

        public Context mark(String path,
           String association)
             throws ContextException
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Annotates the path with the tuple (value sequence) specified by a relation in the domain of attribute product related to the context data nodes.The relation can be either a single search attribute (property) or attribute product. The search attribute-value sequence must be separated by the Context.APS. Marked data nodes can be found by their tuples (@link #getMarkedPaths} independently of associative context paths defined by context attributes Context.getValue(java.lang.String, sorcer.service.Parameter...). It is usually assumed that search relations are more stable than user friendly context paths. Tuple attributes and relations must first be registered with the context with (addAttribute}, addProperty, and addRelation) before they are used in contexts.
        Specified by:
        mark in interface Context<T>
        Parameters:
        path - the location in the context namespace
        association - the domain-value sequence
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • getPath

        public String getPath(Object obj)
               throws ContextException
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Returns path of first occurrence of object in the context. Returns null if not found. This method is useful for orphaned objects, but should be used with caution, since the same object can appear in the context in multiple places, and the location may have relevance to interpretation. If an object is orphaned, it is best to re-think how the object was obtained. It is best to refer to the object with the unique path.
        Specified by:
        getPath in interface Context<T>
        Throws:
        ContextException
